#This is the full "New York Approach", combining the EWR, LGA, and JFK sectors into one huge, busy mess.
#This sector has VERY high traffic rates if you play in flow mode - JFK and EWR will both have around 20 planes an hour
#LGA around 17, and so on, decreasing throughout the remaining secondaries. I've added in arrival routes which will descend and vector planes 
#based off of the flow routes listed on the VATSIM SOPs. They technically aren't published procedures, but I just imagine that those planes
#are being handled by other controllers, while you only step in to resolve conflicts (which there will be a lot of). Your main jobs will be as follows:
#1. Give planes final radar vectors to the ILS/RNAV fix - the arrival routes will end before the glide, so you've got to get them onto it
#2. Manage departures - NYAP has basically no published SIDs for whatever reason, so everything will need to be radar vectored to their exits.
#3. Manage arrivals into secondaries - none of the secondary airports have arrival routes, they still require radar vectors all the way. TEB in particular will be a thorn on your side.
#This map also has a few special approaches. KEWR, KLGA, and KJFK each have some configurations where they use RNAV approaches (Landing 29 EWR, 31 LGA, and 13L JFK) rather than vectoring flights into the ILS, as they would conflict with other airports. In those cases, all you need to do is send the flight direct to the respective fix (TETER/GRITY for 29 EWR, GACAR for 31 LGA, and ASALT for 13L JFK) and hit APP. The plane will do the rest.
#If you think you can handle all of these enjoy! If not, then I recommend starting on skill mode, to let things slowly build up.
#NOTE - I've noticed some strange glitches causing planes to freeze when the sweep speed is too high. I recommend setting it to 0.5s for best results.
#Have Fun!! :) ~CessnaSkyhawk

[airspace]
elevation = 13
radius = 60
usa = true
name = new york approach, new york departure
transition = 18001
center = N40.63980103, W73.77890015
speedrestriction = 0, 220, 10000, 250
magneticvar = -14.089
floor = 1100 			; minimum selectable altitude
descendaltitude = 14000 	; minimum initial altitude for arrivals
ceiling = 19000 		; maximum selectable altitude
above = 21000 			; maximum departure altitude when SID is enabled (must be above ceiling)
automatic = true
beacons =
#JFK Beacons
    JFK, N40.37.58.40, W073.46.17.00, kennedy
	COL, N40.3116294, W74.1597286, colts neck
    CAMRN, N40.01.02.29, W073.51.39.81, cameron

#SID Beacons

	040, LIBE, New York Departure, 126.80
